chunks.text: HTM Admin ## THIS PAGE INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK ## CREATE AND MANAGE PMS ## Summary This lesson provides an overview of how to properly create and maintain Preventive Maintenance Plans and Master PMs. It also covers how to use Job Plans both individually and as sequenced Job Plans and Routes on the PMs to create PM Work Orders. Routes are used on PMs intended to cover multiple Assets or Locations to facilitate creating multiple PM Work Orders or Work Orders that list multiple Assets. For more information about this process, please go to Appendix A - Classify Asset Business Process to view the flowchart and step narrative. ## User Roles and Responsibilities The audience for this training includes the following user roles: | Role | Responsibility | |--------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | EPS Admin | Reviews,assigns and approves Work Orders; developsJob Plans; creates PMs (preventive maintenance);prioritizes and schedules PMWork Orders | | FMAdmin | Receives, classifies and disposesbuilding service equipment(BSE) Assets; reviewsand approvesWork Orders; creates PMs (preventive maintenance); approves PMwork deferrals; creates Job Plans | | FMWork Order Clerk | Reviewsand evaluatesService Requests;receives, classifies and disposes building service equipment (BSE) Assets; reviewsand evaluates Service Requests;plans and approves work and assigns Work Ordersto FMshops; creates PMs(Preventive Maintenance) | | HTM Admin | Classifies Assets;reviewsand approves Work Orders; creates PMs (preventive maintenance);approvesPM workdeferrals; creates Job Plans;

ersto FMshops; creates PMs(Preventive Maintenance) | | HTM Admin | Classifies Assets;reviewsand approves Work Orders; creates PMs (preventive maintenance);approvesPM workdeferrals; creates Job Plans; determinesneedfor decontamination/sanitization of turned in Assets | ## Learning Objectives - · Describe how to create and update PMs using Maximo - · Create Draft PMs - · Apply Job Plans to PMs - · Activate PM Records - · Sequence Job Plans on PMs - · Review Routes associated with PMs ## Agenda | Topic | Estimated Time | |-----------------------------|------------------| | Introduction | 10 min | | CreateDraft PMs | 15 min | | Apply JobPlans to PMs | 15 min | | Review/ActivatePMs | 05 min | | Sequencing Job Plans on PMs | 20 min | | PMsAssociatedwithRoutes | 20 min | | Review/KnowledgeCheck | 10 min | | TOTAL: | 95 min | ## ACRONYMS USED IN THIS LESSON | Acronym | Description | |-----------|--------------------------------------| | APPR | Approved | | CM | Corrective Maintenance | | EAWM

10 min | | TOTAL: | 95 min | ## ACRONYMS USED IN THIS LESSON | Acronym | Description | |-----------|--------------------------------------| | APPR | Approved | | CM | Corrective Maintenance | | EAWM | Enterprise Asset& Work Management | | EM | EmergencyMaintenance | | EPS | EnvironmentalPrograms Services | | FM | Facility Management | | HTM | Healthcare TechnologyManagement | | IO | Internal Operations | | PM | Preventive Maintenance | | PPM | PersonalPropertyManagement | | PS | ProfessionalServices | | VAMC | VAMedical Center | | VA-MDNS | VAMedical Device Nomenclature System | ## CREATE DRAFT PM RECORDS Preventive maintenance (PM) records are templates for scheduled preventive maintenance work. They are used to generate preventive maintenance Work Orders. PMs can contain Job Plan and corresponding safety plan information that is copied to Work Orders. You can create a PM with or without an associated Master PM. - Step 1. From the Start Center , select Preventive Maintenance in the F

rresponding safety plan information that is copied to Work Orders. You can create a PM with or without an associated Master PM. - Step 1. From the Start Center , select Preventive Maintenance in the Favorite Applications portlet. The Preventive Maintenance application opens to the List tab. Figure 1. Preventive Maintenance - Step 2. Select the New PM icon on the toolbar. The new PM record opens the PM tab in DRAFT Status . The PM field displays a PM Identifier , which is an automatically assigned unique ID. The Site field auto-populates with your user information. - Step 3. In the Description field, type a short descriptive statement about the PM. For example, Curtain Change location 1-W-1A, Quarterly. Figure 2. Preventive Maintenance List Tab - New PM Figure 3. Description Field ## Step 4. If you want to associate a Master PM with a PM, in the Master PM field select the Detail Menu (chevron) icon then select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and choose the appropriate Master PM

If you want to associate a Master PM with a PM, in the Master PM field select the Detail Menu (chevron) icon then select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and choose the appropriate Master PM. Figure 4. Master PM Field Step 5. In the Details section, the PM must have a value entered into either the Location , Asset , or Route field as the entity for which you intend to schedule work. - · If the PM is for a location, under the Details section in the Location field, select the Detail Menu (chevron) icon then select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and choose the appropriate location. - · If the PM is for an Asset , under the Details section in the Asset field, select the Detail Menu (chevron) icon then select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and choose the appropriate Asset . - · If the PM is against a Route , under the Details section in the Route field, select the Detail Menu (chevron) icon then select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and choose the app

- · If the PM is against a Route , under the Details section in the Route field, select the Detail Menu (chevron) icon then select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and choose the appropriate Route . Figure 5. Details Section, Location, Asset, and Route Fields Step 6. If appropriate, in the Lead Time (Days) field, enter the number of days in advance of the Next Due Date that Maximo should generate Work Orders from this PM. Figure 6. Enter Value into Lead Time, If Appropriate - Step 7. If parts are required to complete the PM, select the check box to the right of the Parts Required? field. Advanced planning may be required to ensure the parts are ordered in advance to complete the PM on time. Figure 7. Select Parts Required Checkbox, If Applicable Step 8. If the PM needs to be outsourced to a third party, select the check box to the right of the Outsourced? field. Advanced planning may be required to ensure there is a valid contract in place 90 days prior to the PM due

be outsourced to a third party, select the check box to the right of the Outsourced? field. Advanced planning may be required to ensure there is a valid contract in place 90 days prior to the PM due date to ensure PM service is completed on time. Figure 8. Select Outsourced, If Appropriate Step 9. View the Work Order Information section, which contains the data that populates when the Work Order is generated from the PM. Figure 9. Work Order Information Step 10. If appropriate, in the Job Plan field, select the Detail Menu (chevron) icon and then select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon to choose a Job Plan. NOTE: A Job Plan is a detailed description of work to be performed on a Location or Asset. When a PM has an associated Job Plan, the Job Plan becomes a work plan on any Work Order generated from the PM. Only one PM record per Location or Asset is needed so Job Plans can be applied for the daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, semiannual, or annual PMs.

work plan on any Work Order generated from the PM. Only one PM record per Location or Asset is needed so Job Plans can be applied for the daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, semiannual, or annual PMs. Step 11. In the Work Type field, select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and choose the appropriate value. This populates the Work Type field of the auto-generated Work Order. The work type values include: - · CM - Corrective Maintenance - · EM - Emergency Maintenance - · IO - Internal Operations - · PM - Preventive Maintenance - · PS - Professional Services Step 12. If appropriate, you can change the Work Order Status by selecting the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and then choosing the appropriate value. The field defaults to APPR (Approved). Step 13. If desired, in the Priority field, enter the priority (1, 2, 3, or 4) for the Work Order. Step 14. Under the Responsibility section, next to the Responsible Department field, select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon an

ty field, enter the priority (1, 2, 3, or 4) for the Work Order. Step 14. Under the Responsibility section, next to the Responsible Department field, select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and choose the appropriate department. The options are: - · EPS - Environmental Programs Services - · FM - Facility Management - · HTM - Healthcare Technology Management/Biomedical Engineering - · PPM - Non Expendable Equipment Technicians NOTE: When a PM is created with an associated Master PM, the Responsible Department field populates based on the Master PM; not the PM. You may also associate the PM with a Responsible Shop and/or Responsible Tech , but this is not required. Figure 10. Responsible Department Step 15. Select the Save PM icon on the toolbar. Step 16. Select the Frequency tab. Figure 11. Select Frequency Tab ## Step 17. The Use Last Work Order's Start Date to Calculate Next Due Date? check box is selected by default. IMPORTANT!

Step 16. Select the Frequency tab. Figure 11. Select Frequency Tab ## Step 17. The Use Last Work Order's Start Date to Calculate Next Due Date? check box is selected by default. IMPORTANT! Leave the check box checked. Figure 12. Work Order Generation Information Section NOTE: In the Work Order Generation Information section, the Use Last Work Order's Start Date to Calculate Next Due Date? option is selected by default. Leave the check box selected ! When selected, Work Orders generate on a fixed schedule calculated from the target start date of the last Work Order. - Step 18. On the Time Based Frequency sub-tab, enter a number in the Frequency field. - Step 19. In the Frequency Units field, select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and then select Days , Months Weeks , , or Years . - Step 20. If applicable, in the Alert Lead (Days) field, enter the number of days prior to the PM due date when the user will receive a message indicating that a PM is about to generate a

- Step 20. If applicable, in the Alert Lead (Days) field, enter the number of days prior to the PM due date when the user will receive a message indicating that a PM is about to generate a Work Order. - Step 21. Select the Estimated Next Due Date icon and then select the next Work Order generation date. If the Use Last Work Order's Start Date to Calculate Next Due Date? check box is selected, the Estimated Next Due Date is calculated by adding the Frequency value to the Target Start Date of the last Work Order. Figure 13. Work Order Generation Information Section Step 22. Select the Save icon on the toolbar. - Step 23. Before the PM can be used, the Status must be changed to Active . Refer to the Activating a PM section below. ## APPLY JOB PLANS TO PM RECORDS You can assign a Job Plan to a Preventive Maintenance (PM) record so that the Job Plan becomes a Work Plan on any Work Order you generate from the PM. When you add a single Job Plan to the Job Plan Sequence tab, the Job

b Plan to a Preventive Maintenance (PM) record so that the Job Plan becomes a Work Plan on any Work Order you generate from the PM. When you add a single Job Plan to the Job Plan Sequence tab, the Job Plan does not appear in the Job Plan field on the PM tab. A Job Plan only appears in the Job Plan field of the PM tab when the following criteria are met: - · You add the Job Plan directly to the PM tab - · You add more than one Job Plan on the Job Plan Sequence tab - Step 1. From the Start Center, select Preventive Maintenance in the Favorite Applications portlet. The Preventive Maintenance application opens to the List tab. Figure 14. Preventive Maintenance Step 2. Use the Filter Fields on the List tab to locate the desired PM record. NOTE: To view all draft PMs for your site, enter Draft in the Status field. Step 3. Select the PM you want to activate. The selected PM opens on the PM tab. Figure 15. Preventive Maintenance List Tab Step 4.

o view all draft PMs for your site, enter Draft in the Status field. Step 3. Select the PM you want to activate. The selected PM opens on the PM tab. Figure 15. Preventive Maintenance List Tab Step 4. If the PM is to be used for a single Job Plan, under the Work Order Information section, in the Job Plan field, select the Detail Menu (chevron) icon, then select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and choose the appropriate Job Plan . Figure 16. Work Order Information Step 5. If the PM is to be used for multiple sequenced Job Plans, select the Job Plan Sequence tab. NOTE: Job Plan sequences let you schedule different levels of maintenance work at specified intervals. By assigning a sequence number to each Job Plan, you specify which Job Plan is selected each time a Work Order is generated from the PM. You can add a sequence of three Job Plans to specify different inspections of an Asset: - · A monthly basic inspection of an Asset - · A quarterly inspection of its components - · A y

You can add a sequence of three Job Plans to specify different inspections of an Asset: - · A monthly basic inspection of an Asset - · A quarterly inspection of its components - · A yearly inspection and adjustment of the Asset and its components Step 6. To add multiple Job Plans , under the Job Plan Sequence section, select the New Row button in the bottom right corner. - Step 7. Select the Detail Menu (chevron) icon next to the Job Plan field and then select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and choose the appropriate Job Plan . Step 8. Enter a sequence number in the Sequence field. Figure 17. Job Plan Sequence Step 9. Repeat steps 6 thru 8 to enter additional Job Plans . Step 10. Select the Save icon on the toolbar. ## ACTIVATING PM RECORDS When a PM Record is created, the initial status is set to DRAFT. When you are ready to generate Work Orders, you will need to change the status to ACTIVE. Change the status to INACTIVE when the PM is no longer useful.

When you are ready to generate Work Orders, you will need to change the status to ACTIVE. Change the status to INACTIVE when the PM is no longer useful. - Step 1. From the Start Center , select Preventive Maintenance in the Favorite Applications portlet. The Preventive Maintenance application opens to the List tab. - Step 2. Use the Filter Fields on the List tab to locate the desired PM record. Figure 18. Preventive Maintenance NOTE: To view all draft PMs for your site, enter Draft in the Status field. - Step 3. Select the PM you want to activate. The selected PM opens on the PM tab. - Step 4. Select the Change Status icon on the toolbar. - Step 5. In the New Status field, select Active from the drop-down menu. Roll NOTE: If you want to change all Child PM statuses, select the check box next to the New Status to all Child PMs? check box. Step 6. Select the OK button. The Change Status dialog box closes.

Roll NOTE: If you want to change all Child PM statuses, select the check box next to the New Status to all Child PMs? check box. Step 6. Select the OK button. The Change Status dialog box closes. Figure 19. Change Status ## SEQUENCING JOB PLANS ON PMS WITH THE PM COUNTER By assigning a sequence number to each Job Plan, you specify which Job Plan is selected each time a Work Order is generated from the PM. When you generate a Work Order from a PM with a Job Plan sequence, the Job Plan with the highest sequence number that divides evenly into the value in the Counter field is selected. If no sequence number meets this criterion, the primary Job Plan (sequence number one) is used. You can view the current counter setting on the PM tab. The counter is set to zero when you insert a new PM record. It increases each time you generate a top-level Work Order from the PM Table 1. Job Plan Sequence Examples | Description | Sequence | Meaning | |--------------------|------------|-------------

It increases each time you generate a top-level Work Order from the PM Table 1. Job Plan Sequence Examples | Description | Sequence | Meaning | |--------------------|------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | Monthly Job Plan | 1 | This is the defaultJob Plan. It is usedunless the sequence calls for a differentJob Plan. This Job Plan is usedwhen the Counter is divisible ONLY by one. | | Quarterly Job Plan | 3 | This Job Plan is used whenthreeis the highest number that divides evenlyinto the Counter field. With the frequencysetto once a month,this Job Plan is used on the third, sixth, and ninth month. | | Annual Job Plan | 12 | This JobPlan is used when12 is the highest numberthat divides evenlyinto the value in the Counter field. | - Step 1. Start this section with the PM created above or create a new PM with thr

lan | 12 | This JobPlan is used when12 is the highest numberthat divides evenlyinto the value in the Counter field. | - Step 1. Start this section with the PM created above or create a new PM with three Job Plans listed on the Job Plan Sequence tab. The three Job Plans should include a monthly, quarterly, and annual Job Plans for the example used in this lesson. - Step 2. In the Details section, Verify the PM Counter field is set to zero. Figure 20. Preventive Maintenance Tab Details Section - Step 3. If the PM Counter field is not set to zero, use the Select Action menu to select Set PM Counter and enter 0 in the New PM Counter field. - Step 4. Select OK on the Set PM Counter window. - Step 5. Select the Frequency tab. - Step 6. In the Frequency field on the Time-Based Reporting section, enter a value that will correspond with the Frequency Units to determine how often this PM should run. In this example enter the value '1.' - Step 7. In the Frequency Units field on the Time-Based Fre

enter a value that will correspond with the Frequency Units to determine how often this PM should run. In this example enter the value '1.' - Step 7. In the Frequency Units field on the Time-Based Frequency section, enter a value that will correspond with the Frequency field to determine how often this PM should run. In this example enter the value 'MONTHS'. - Step 8. Select the Save icon on the toolbar. Figure 21. PM Application Select Action>Set PM Counter Figure 22. Preventive Maintenance Application Frequency Tab Figure 23. PM Frequency tab Time Based Frequency Section ## Step 9. Select the Job Plan Sequence tab. Figure 24. PM Job Plan Sequence Tab - Step 10. The Job Plan Sequence section should contain three Job Plans . If it does not, follow the next three steps to add three Job Plans with sequence numbers of '1', '3', and '12'. - Step 11. To add multiple Job Plans , under the Job Plan Sequence section, select the New Row button in the bottom right corner.

ps to add three Job Plans with sequence numbers of '1', '3', and '12'. - Step 11. To add multiple Job Plans , under the Job Plan Sequence section, select the New Row button in the bottom right corner. - Step 12. Select the Detail Menu (chevron) icon next to the Job Plan field and then select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and choose the appropriate Job Plan. - Step 13. Enter a sequence number in the Sequence field. Use the values '1', '3', and '12' for this example. - Step 14. Select the Save icon on the toolbar. Figure 25. Preventive Maintenance Table 2. Resulting PM Forecast | PMSchedule 12 Month Forecast | | |--------------------------------|--------------| | January | Monthly PM | | February | Monthly PM | | March | Quarterly PM | | April | Monthly PM | | May | Monthly PM | | June | Quarterly PM | | July | Monthly PM | | August | Monthly PM | | September | Quarterly PM | | October | Monthly PM | | November | Monthly PM | | December | Annual PM | ## PMS ASSOCIATED WITH ROU

June | Quarterly PM | | July | Monthly PM | | August | Monthly PM | | September | Quarterly PM | | October | Monthly PM | | November | Monthly PM | | December | Annual PM | ## PMS ASSOCIATED WITH ROUTES When you generate Preventive Maintenance (PM) records for Assets or locations on a route, you create a simple Work Order hierarchy. This hierarchy has a parent Work Order for the Asset or location on the PM record. The child records in the hierarchy are for each Asset or location listed on the route. If there are sequence numbers on the Assets on the route, they are applied to the generated Work Orders. Duplicate sequence numbers are allowed. The Job Plan for the Asset's Work Order comes from the Job Plan for the Asset at that stop on the route. If there is no Job Plan for the Asset at the route stop, the Job Plan comes from the PM record. ## Step 1. From the Go To menu, select Planning>Routes to open the Routes application. Figure 26.

If there is no Job Plan for the Asset at the route stop, the Job Plan comes from the PM record. ## Step 1. From the Go To menu, select Planning>Routes to open the Routes application. Figure 26. Go To menu, Planning Routes - Step 2. Select the New Route icon on the Toolbar . The new Route record opens and the Site field auto-populates with your user information. - Step 3. Enter a route ID in the Route field and a description in the Route Description field. - Step 4. Use the Route option to create child Work Orders by selecting the Child Work Orders radio button . ## Step 5. To add Assets to the Route, select the Select Assets button. The Select Assets window will open. Figure 27. Routes Application, Route Tab - Step 6. Use the Filter Fields (e.g., the Asset Description field) to narrow the search results to a desired set of Assets . - Step 7. To select Assets , check the Select Record returned to the Route record. check box next to each Asset to be - Step 8.

ription field) to narrow the search results to a desired set of Assets . - Step 7. To select Assets , check the Select Record returned to the Route record. check box next to each Asset to be - Step 8. Select the OK to return the selected Assets back to the Route record. - Step 9. Select the Save icon on the toolbar. Figure 28. Select Assets Step 10. In the Preventive Maintenance application on the PM tab, display or create the PM record that you want to apply the Route. Step 11. In the Details section in the Route field, select the Detail Menu (chevron) icon then select the Select Value (magnifying glass) icon and choose the appropriate Route . In this case use the Route created above. Step 12. In the Work Order Information section in the Job Plan field, select the Detail Menu (chevron) icon then select the Select Value appropriate Job Plan . Step 13. Select the Save icon on the toolbar. (magnifying glass) icon and choose the Figure 29. Preventive Maintenance Application, PM Tab - Step

on then select the Select Value appropriate Job Plan . Step 13. Select the Save icon on the toolbar. (magnifying glass) icon and choose the Figure 29. Preventive Maintenance Application, PM Tab - Step 14. Select the Change Status icon on the toolbar. - Step 15. In the New Status field, select Active from the drop-down menu. - Step 16. Select OK . The Change Status dialog box closes. Figure 30. Preventive Maintenance, Change Status Dialog Box Step 17. From the Select Action menu, select Generate Work Orders . Figure 31. Select Action Menu Step 18. On the Generate Work Orders window, to generate Work Orders on demand without using the actual PM Schedule, deselect the Use Frequency Criteria check box and then select OK . Figure 32. Generate Work Orders Window Step 19. When the Work Orders are generated, Maximo displays the System Message showing the created Work Order ID's. Figure 33. Preventive Maintenance System Message NOTE: The first Work Order displayed in the System Message is the P

generated, Maximo displays the System Message showing the created Work Order ID's. Figure 33. Preventive Maintenance System Message NOTE: The first Work Order displayed in the System Message is the Parent Work Order and the following Work Orders are the Child Work Orders. We will see this relationship when we display and view the Parent Work Order ## Step 20. From the Go To menu, select Work Orders>Work Order Tracking to go to the Work Order Tracking application. Figure 34. Go To Menu, Work Orders, Work Order Tracking Step 21. In the Work Order Tracking application, use the Find field to enter the Parent Work Order ID that was generated above and select the Find icon Work Order will display on the Work Order tab. - (magnifying glass). The - Step 22. Select the Plans tab. Figure 35. Work Order Tracking Application Step 23. In the Children of Work Order section the Child Work Orders generated from the Route on the PM are displayed. - Step 24.

Select the Plans tab. Figure 35. Work Order Tracking Application Step 23. In the Children of Work Order section the Child Work Orders generated from the Route on the PM are displayed. - Step 24. The Tasks for Work Order section displays the Tasks from the Job Plan that was applied to the PM record. NOTE: If there were Job Plans specified at each Route Stop on the Route, those Job Plans will be on the individual Child Work Orders and there would be no Tasks displayed on this Parent Work Order. Figure 36. Task for Work Order Section, Plan Tab ## REVIEW ## Knowledge Check ## 'A Minute to Win It' Use your Guide, if needed, to answer the following questions within the minute allowed. - 1. Where do you set how often the PM record will generate Work Orders? - a. On the Job Plan Sequence tab - b. On the Meter Based Frequency sub tab under the Frequency tab - c. On the Time-Based Frequency sub tab under the Frequency tab - d. Both B and C are correct - 2.

On the Job Plan Sequence tab - b. On the Meter Based Frequency sub tab under the Frequency tab - c. On the Time-Based Frequency sub tab under the Frequency tab - d. Both B and C are correct - 2. One single PM schedule can generate Work Orders for monthly, quarterly, and annual Job Plans. - a. True - b. False - 3. When a Route is applied to a Work Order from a PM the Route Stops become… - a. Child Work Orders - b. Entries in the Work Orders Multi Assets, Locations CI's Table - c. Work Order Tasks - d. Any of the above depending on which option is selected on the Route record ## APPENDIX A - CLASSIFY ASSET BUSINESS PROCESS FLOW Figure 37. Classify Asset Business Process Flow Table 3. Classify Asset Business Process Narrative | Step Number | Description | |---------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 1.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 1.10.1 | The Admin (HTM) receives a newAsset(s) andhas a needto assign a VA-MDNSAssetequipmentcategory and related national standards. The HTM Admin opensthe Asset(s) record and selects the VA-MDNScodefor the Asset. | | 1.10.2 | The Admin (HTM) applies an AssetTemplate to a newAsset(s) in Maximo that will contain values for the Asset(s). | | 1.10.3 | The Admin (HTM) will apply a PMscheduleto the Asset(s) throughthe Assettemplate or through the PM application. | | 1.10.4 | Maximo applies a PMto everynewAsset,based on the MasterPM selected for the Asset. | | 1.10.5 | The Admin (HTM) at a site may customize the PMcreatedby Maximo.
